user_query: Who wrote Romeo and Juliet?

ground_truth.text: Romeo and Juliet was written by William Shakespeare.

ground_truth.text: The chemical symbol for gold is Au.

user_query: Who was the first person to walk on the moon?

ground_truth.text: Neil Armstrong was the first person to walk on the moon on July 20, 1969.

user_query: What is the speed of light?

ground_truth.text: The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 299,792,458 meters per second.

ground_truth.text: The Mona Lisa was painted by Leonardo da Vinci.

ground_truth.text: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system.

ground_truth.text: Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in 1876.

ground_truth.text: The adult human body has 206 bones.

ground_truth.text: A hexagon has six sides.

ground_truth.text: Diamond is the hardest natural substance on Earth.

ground_truth.text: The lion is known as the King of the Jungle.

ground_truth.text: The Antarctic Desert is the largest desert in the world.

ground_truth.text: Marie Curie was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize, receiving it in Physics in 1903.

ground_truth.text: Humans have 23 pairs of chromosomes, for a total of 46 chromosomes.

ground_truth.text: The Nile River is the longest river in the world.

ground_truth.text: The Bee Hummingbird is the smallest bird in the world.

ground_truth.text: Nitrogen is the most abundant element in Earth's atmosphere.

ground_truth.text: The Great Wall of China is primarily made of stone, brick, wood, and rammed earth.

ground_truth.text: The skin is the human body's largest organ.
